connector.description:
Write object to an Infinispan cache.

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `key` / `ce-key`: as the key to use when put an object in the Infinispan cache.

If the header won't be set the exchange ID will be used as key.

camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.cacheName.name: camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.cacheName
camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.cacheName.description: The name of the Infinispan cache to use

camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.hosts.name: camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.hosts
camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.hosts.description: Specifies the host of the cache on Infinispan instance

camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.secure.name: camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.secure
camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.secure.description: If the Infinispan instance is secured or not

camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.securityRe.name: camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.securityRealm
camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.securityRe.description: Define the security realm to access the infinispan instance

camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.securitySe.name: camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.securityServerName
camel.kamelet.infinispan-sink.securitySe.description: Define the security server name to access the infinispan instance
